grag.components.embedding module

Class for embedding.

This module provides: - Embedding

class grag.components.embedding.Embedding(embedding_type: str, embedding_model: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class for vector embeddings.

Supports:

huggingface sentence transformers -> model_type = ‘sentence-transformers’ huggingface instructor embeddings -> model_type = ‘instructor-embedding’

embedding_type[source]

embedding model type, refer above for supported types

embedding_model[source]

huggingface model name

embedding_function[source]

langchain embedding type

grag.components.llm module

Class for LLM.

class grag.components.llm.LLM(model_name='Llama-2-13b-chat', device_map='auto', task='text-generation', max_new_tokens='1024', temperature='0.1', n_batch='1024', n_ctx='6000', n_gpu_layers='-1', std_out='True', base_dir='/home/ubuntu/volume_2k/Capstone_5/models', quantization='Q5_K_M', pipeline='llama_cpp')[source]

Bases: object

A class for managing and utilizing large language models (LLMs).

hf_pipeline(is_local=False)[source]

Loads the model using Hugging Face transformers.

Parameters:

is_local (bool) – Whether to load the model from a local path.

llama_cpp()[source]

Loads the model using a custom CPP pipeline.

load_model(model_name=None, pipeline=None, quantization=None, is_local=None)[source]

Loads the model based on the specified pipeline and model name.

Parameters:

  • quantization (str) – Quantization of the LLM model like Q5_K_M, f16, etc. Optional.

  • model_name (str) – The name of the model to load. Optional.

  • pipeline (str) – The pipeline to use for loading the model. Defaults to ‘llama_cpp’.

  • is_local (bool) – Whether the model is loaded from a local directory. Defaults to True.

property model_name[source]

Returns the name of the model.

property model_path[source]

Sets the model name.

grag.components.multivec_retriever module

Class for retriever.

This module provides: - Retriever

class grag.components.multivec_retriever.Retriever(vectordb: VectorDB | None = None, store_path: str = '/home/ubuntu/volume_2k/Capstone_5/data/docs', id_key: str = 'doc_id', namespace: str = '8c9040b0b5cd4d7cbc2e737da1b24ebf', top_k=3, client_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for multi vector retriever.

It connects to a vector database and a local file store. It is used to return most similar chunks from a vector store but has the additional functionality to return a linked document, chunk, etc.

store_path[source]

Path to the local file store

id_key[source]

A key prefix for identifying documents

vectordb[source]

ChromaClient class instance from components.client

store[source]

langchain.storage.LocalFileStore object, stores the key value pairs of document id and parent file

retriever[source]

langchain.retrievers.multi_vector.MultiVectorRetriever class instance, langchain’s multi-vector retriever

splitter[source]

TextSplitter class instance from components.text_splitter

namespace[source]

Namespace for producing unique id

top_k[source]

Number of top chunks to return from similarity search.

async aadd_docs(docs: List[Document])[source]

Adds given documents into the vector database also adds the parent document into the file store.

Parameters:

docs – List of langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

None

add_docs(docs: List[Document])[source]

Adds given documents into the vector database also adds the parent document into the file store.

Parameters:

docs – List of langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

None

async aget_chunk(query: str, with_score=False, top_k=None)[source]

Returns the most (cosine) similar chunks from the vector database, asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • query – A query string

  • with_score – Outputs scores of returned chunks

  • top_k – Number of top similar chunks to return, if None defaults to self.top_k

Returns:

list of Documents

async aget_doc(query: str)[source]

Returns the parent documents of the most (cosine) similar chunks from the vector database.

Parameters:

query – A query string

Returns:

Documents

async aingest(dir_path: str | Path, glob_pattern: str = '**/*.pdf', dry_run: bool = False, verbose: bool = True, parser_kwargs: dict = None)[source]

Asynchronously ingests the files in directory.

Parameters:

  • dir_path – path to the directory

  • glob_pattern – glob pattern to identify files

  • dry_run – if True, does not ingest any files

  • verbose – if True, shows progress

  • parser_kwargs – arguments to pass to the parser

gen_doc_ids(docs: List[Document]) → List[str][source]

Takes a list of documents and produces a list of unique id, refer id_gen method for more details.

Parameters:

docs – List of langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

List of hexadecimal uuid

Returns the most similar chunks from the vector database.

Parameters:

  • query – A query string

  • with_score – Outputs scores of returned chunks

  • top_k – Number of top similar chunks to return, if None defaults to self.top_k

Returns:

list of Documents

get_doc(query: str)[source]

Returns the parent document of the most (cosine) similar chunk from the vector database.

Parameters:

query – A query string

Returns:

Documents

get_docs_from_chunks(chunks: List[Document], one_to_one=False)[source]

Returns the parent documents of chunks.

Parameters:

  • chunks – chunks from vector store

  • one_to_one – if True, returns parent doc for each chunk

Returns:

parent documents

id_gen(doc: Document) → str[source]

Takes a document and returns a unique id (uuid5) using the namespace and document source.

This ensures that a single document always gets the same unique id.

Parameters:

doc – langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

string of hexadecimal uuid

ingest(dir_path: str | Path, glob_pattern: str = '**/*.pdf', dry_run: bool = False, verbose: bool = True, parser_kwargs: dict = None)[source]

Ingests the files in directory.

Parameters:

  • dir_path – path to the directory

  • glob_pattern – glob pattern to identify files

  • dry_run – if True, does not ingest any files

  • verbose – if True, shows progress

  • parser_kwargs – arguments to pass to the parser

split_docs(docs: List[Document]) → List[Document][source]

Takes a list of documents and splits them into smaller chunks.

Using TextSplitter from components.text_splitter Also adds the unique parent document id into metadata

Parameters:

docs – List of langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

list of chunks after splitting

grag.components.parse_pdf module

Classes for parsing files.

This module provides: - ParsePDF

class grag.components.parse_pdf.ParsePDF(single_text_out='True', strategy='hi_res', infer_table_structure='True', extract_images='True', image_output_dir='None', add_captions_to_text='True', add_captions_to_blocks='True', table_as_html='True')[source]

Bases: object

Parsing and partitioning PDF documents into Text, Table or Image elements.

single_text_out[source]

Whether to combine all text elements into a single output document.

Type:

bool

strategy[source]

The strategy for PDF partitioning; default is “hi_res” for better accuracy.

Type:

str

extract_image_block_types[source]

Elements to be extracted as image blocks.

Type:

list

infer_table_structure[source]

Whether to extract tables during partitioning.

Type:

bool

extract_images[source]

Whether to extract images.

Type:

bool

image_output_dir[source]

Directory to save extracted images, if any.

Type:

str

add_captions_to_text[source]

Whether to include figure captions in text output. Default is True.

Type:

bool

add_captions_to_blocks[source]

Whether to add captions to table and image blocks. Default is True.

Type:

bool

add_caption_first[source]

Whether to place captions before their corresponding image or table in the output. Default is True.

Type:

bool

classify(partitions)[source]

Classifies the partitioned elements into Text, Tables, and Images list in a dictionary.

Also adds captions for each element (if available).

Parameters:

partitions (list) – The list of partitioned elements from the PDF document.

Returns:

A dictionary with keys ‘Text’, ‘Tables’, and ‘Images’, each containing a list of corresponding elements.

Return type:

dict

load_file(path)[source]

Loads a PDF file, partitions and classifies its elements, and processes these elements into Documents.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path of the PDF document to be loaded and processed.

Returns:

A dictionary with keys ‘Text’, ‘Tables’, and ‘Images’, each containing a list of processed Document instances.

Return type:

dict

partition(path: str)[source]

Partitions a PDF document into elements based on the instance’s configuration.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path of the PDF document to be parsed and partitioned.

Returns:

A list of partitioned elements from the PDF document.

Return type:

list

process_images(elements)[source]

Processes image elements into Documents, including handling of captions if specified.

Parameters:

elements (list) – The list of image elements (and optional captions) to be processed.

Returns:

A list of Document instances containing the Images, their caption and metadata.

Return type:

docs (list)

process_tables(elements)[source]

Processes table elements into Documents, including handling of captions if specified.

Parameters:

elements (list) – The list of table elements (and optional captions) to be processed.

Returns:

A list of Document instances containing Tables, their captions and metadata.

Return type:

docs (list)

process_text(elements)[source]

Processes text elements into langchain Documents.

Parameters:

elements (list) – The list of text elements to be processed.

Returns:

A list of Document instances containing the extracted Text content and their metadata.

Return type:

docs (list)

text_concat(elements) → str[source]

Context aware concatenates all elements into a single string.

grag.components.prompt module

Classes for prompts.

This module provides: - Prompt - for generic prompts - FewShotPrompt - for few-shot prompts

grag.components.text_splitter module

Class for splitting/chunking text.

This module provides: - TextSplitter

class grag.components.text_splitter.TextSplitter(chunk_size: int = '5000', chunk_overlap: int = '400')[source]

Bases: object

Class for recursively chunking text, it prioritizes ‘/n/n then ‘/n’ and so on.

chunk_size[source]

maximum size of chunk

chunk_overlap[source]

chunk overlap size

text_splitter[source]

Initialize TextSplitter using chunk_size and chunk_overlap

grag.components.utils module

Utils functions.

This module provides: - stuff_docs: concats langchain documents into string - load_prompt: loads json prompt to langchain prompt - find_config_path: finds the path of the ‘config.ini’ file by traversing up the directory tree from the current path. - get_config: retrieves and parses the configuration settings from the ‘config.ini’ file.

grag.components.utils.display_llm_output_and_sources(response_from_llm)[source]

Displays the result from an LLM response and lists the sources.

Args: response_from_llm (dict): The response object from an LLM which includes the result and source documents.

grag.components.utils.find_config_path(current_path: Path) → Path[source]

Finds the path of the ‘config.ini’ file by traversing up the directory tree from the current path.

This function starts at the current path and moves up the directory tree until it finds a file named ‘config.ini’. If ‘config.ini’ is not found by the time the root of the directory tree is reached, a FileNotFoundError is raised.

Parameters:

current_path (Path) – The starting point for the search, typically the location of the script being executed.

Returns:

The path to the found ‘config.ini’ file.

Return type:

Path

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If ‘config.ini’ cannot be found in any of the parent directories.

grag.components.utils.get_config() → ConfigParser[source]

Retrieves and parses the configuration settings from the ‘config.ini’ file.

This function locates the ‘config.ini’ file by calling find_config_path using the script’s current location. It initializes a ConfigParser object to read the configuration settings from the located ‘config.ini’ file.

Returns:

A parser object containing the configuration settings from ‘config.ini’.

Return type:

ConfigParser

grag.components.utils.load_prompt(json_file: str | PathLike, return_input_vars=False)[source]

Loads a prompt template from json file and returns a langchain ChatPromptTemplate.

Parameters:

  • json_file – path to the prompt template json file.

  • return_input_vars – if true returns a list of expected input variables for the prompt.

Returns:

langchain_core.prompts.ChatPromptTemplate (and a list of input vars if return_input_vars is True)

grag.components.utils.reformat_text_with_line_breaks(input_text, max_width=110)[source]

Reformat the given text to ensure each line does not exceed a specific width, preserving existing line breaks.

Args: input_text (str): The text to be reformatted. max_width (int): The maximum width of each line.

Returns: str: The reformatted text with preserved line breaks and adjusted line width.

grag.components.utils.stuff_docs(docs: List[Document]) → str[source]

Concatenates langchain documents into a string using ‘nn’ seperator.

Parameters:

docs – List of langchain_core.documents.Document

Returns:

string of document page content joined by ‘nn’
